page.title: 04Hallsands & The Trouts
page.content: ..which overwhelmed the village.Sea defences were breached & the sea sucked away the gravel on which the village was built;those buildings not founded on solid rock collapsed into the chasms opened beneath them.Now only a few houses remain-those built on solid rock.Payment of compensation led to the building of North Hallsands,but delayed payment meant many families were poverty stricken & forced to move elsewhere.About forty dwelling now constitute the village; fishing is no longer carried out,with many residents being retired people who have moved into the village. {The Trout Sisters & Trouts' Hotel.} Above the ruined village is Trouts' Hotel(SX818388),now converted to holiday flats & a tearoom.It was built by the Trout Sisters;Ella , Clara , Patience & Edith.
